Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Assessing Cosmetic Outcomes in Breast Conserving Therapy for Multiple Ipsilateral Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Participants.evidence: This multicenter randomised controlled trial included women with 2 or 3 biopsy-proven malignancies separated by â‰¥2 cm within the same breast.

Intervention.evidence: This trial aimed to evaluate the cosmetic outcomes of breast conserving therapy (BCT) in women with MIBC.

Objective.evidence: This trial aimed to evaluate the cosmetic outcomes of breast conserving therapy (BCT) in women with MIBC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was cosmetic outcome, assessed using a 4-point cosmesis survey and the BREAST-Q, over a 3-year period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted at the patient level, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 216 women were randomised, with 136 completing the 2-year postoperative survey.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on a per-protocol basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 2 years postoperatively, 70.6% (N=96) of patients reported good or excellent cosmetic outcomes, while 3.7% (N=5) reported poor outcomes.
